News.Title: Mirza International Appoints New Internal Auditor for FY2025-26
News.Summary: Mirza International Limited's Board of Directors approved the appointment of Mr. Prakhar Pratap Singh as Internal Auditor for financial year 2025-26, replacing Ms. Prachi Mishra who resigned from her employment with the company. Mr. Singh heads Finance Accounts at Unit-2, Unnao and has over two decades of experience in Finance Accounts. He currently provides independent assurance for organizations' risk management, governance and control processes. Ms. Prachi Mishra, who served as AGM-Accounts and Internal Auditor, tendered her resignation from the company. The Board meeting was held on November 8, 2025.

News.Title: Mirza International Reports Decline in Q2 Financial Performance
News.Summary: Mirza International reported quarterly results showing a decline across key financial metrics. Net profit dropped to 21.5 million rupees from 59 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue decreased to 1.65 billion rupees compared to 2.02 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA fell to 126.7 million rupees from 168.8 million rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 7.69% from 8.37% in the previous year.

News.Title: Mirza International Reports Mixed Financial Results for Quarter Ended September 2025
News.Summary: Mirza International Limited announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter and half-year ended September 30, 2025. The Board of Directors approved the standalone and consolidated financial results at their meeting held on November 8, 2025. The company operates in two main segments: Footwear (Domestic/Export Sale) and Tannery (Domestic/Export Sale). The results include operations of wholly owned subsidiaries RTS Fashion Limited, Genesis Brands Private Limited, and Genesis Brands Inc. USA. The Board has also approved a Scheme of Amalgamation of RTS Fashion Limited with Mirza International Limited, subject to necessary approvals. The company has adopted IndAS 116 for lease assets, which impacted rent expenses, depreciation, and finance costs. Statutory auditors conducted a limited review and expressed an unmodified report on the financial results.

News.Title: Mirza International Surges 30% in Two Sessions, Turns Positive for 2025
News.Summary: Mirza International's shares gained 13% on Wednesday following a 15% advance on Tuesday, bringing the total two-day rally to over 30%. The footwear stock has turned positive on a year-to-date basis after recent underperformance. Trading volumes surged significantly, with over 30 lakh shares changing hands on Wednesday compared to the 20-day average of around 70,000 shares. The rally occurred after Mirza's demerged entity Redtape confirmed Income Tax department searches, though Redtape stated it fully cooperated and business continues as usual. The stock crossed its 50 and 200-day moving averages and is approaching its 52-week high of ₹48, currently trading at ₹42.61. Footwear stocks may benefit from reduced GST rates, with footwear up to ₹2,500 now taxed at 5% instead of 12%.

News.Title: Mirza International Undergoes Income Tax Department Search and Seizure Operation
News.Summary: Mirza International underwent a search and seizure operation conducted by the Income Tax Department from September 11 to 16, 2025. The company stated that its operations remained unaffected during this period and that it provided full cooperation to the officials throughout the process.

News.Title: Mirza International Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with Exceptional Items Boosting Profit
News.Summary: Mirza International Limited approved its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported standalone revenue from operations of Rs. 14,142.04 lakhs, up from Rs. 13,712.07 lakhs in the same quarter last year. Standalone profit for the period reached Rs. 1,766.76 lakhs compared to Rs. 109.67 lakhs in the previous year quarter, significantly boosted by exceptional items worth Rs. 1,861.44 lakhs. Basic earnings per share improved to Rs. 1.28 from Rs. 0.08 in the corresponding quarter. On a consolidated basis, revenue from operations was Rs. 14,210.55 lakhs versus Rs. 14,351.15 lakhs in the prior year quarter, with consolidated profit at Rs. 1,780.84 lakhs compared to Rs. 64.19 lakhs previously. The company operates through two main segments: Footwear (domestic and export) and Tannery operations. The Board also approved a scheme of amalgamation of RTS Fashion Limited with Mirza International Limited, subject to necessary approvals.
